A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I watched The Force Awakens in Hong Kong when it was released two years ago. It was a spectacular movie\, but I left the cinema disappointed because it seemed mostly to retell an old familiar story. The Last Jedi is different. It moves the Star Wars saga forward with creativity\, surprise\, heartbreak and suspense. It has so many twists and turns that I need to watch it again. In addition to sizzling special effects\, there was a depth in the dialogue that I don't remember in any previous Star Wars movie\, delving deeply into themes of hope\, disappointment\, failure\, and forgiveness. Did any previous chapter have such pregnant moments of silence? After some more pondering\, I'll be ready for Episode IX.
